article.headline: DePaul 56, St. Louis 53
article.story: ST. LOUIS (AP) -- Drake Diener made the clinching free throws with 9 seconds to go, helping DePaul hold off stubborn Saint Louis 56-53 on Sunday. Quemont Greer overcame early shooting woes to score 16 points for the Blue Demons (15-5, 7-2 Conference USA), who overcame a 10-point first-half deficit. Sammy Mejia had 15 points and four assists and Diener had 12 points, leaving him four points shy of 1,000 for his career. A 36-24 rebounding advantage helped DePaul compensate for 39 percent shooting. Freshman guard Dwayne Polk had a career-best 16 points on 7-for-11 shooting for Saint Louis (5-16, 3-6). With DePaul leading by one point, Greer missed the front end of a 1-and-1 with 12 seconds to go. But Marlon Brumfield tipped the ball back to Diener, an 88-percent free throw shooter. He made both foul shots for a three-point lead. Polk's 3-point attempt to force overtime with about 3 seconds ago was blocked by LaVar Seals. DePaul missed 10 of its first 11 shots and fell behind by 10 points midway through the first half. Mejia scored all 10 of his first-half points over the final 5:30 to help the Blue Demons take a 26-25 lead. Saint Louis got off to a fast start with its two leading scorers, guard Reggie Bryant and forward Izik Ohanon, on the bench. It was the latest lineup tweak by coach Brad Soderberg, who has been trying to salvage a disappointing season. Ian Vouyoukas added 10 points and five rebounds for Saint Louis. But Vouyoukas was only 6-for-11 from the free throw line. Bryant, who leads Saint Louis with a 14-point average, had four points on 1-for-4 shooting. Greer, who averages 19.9 points, was 7-for-18 after missing six of his first eight shots. The game had originally been scheduled for Saturday. It was moved to Sunday because of the Cory Spinks-Zab Judah fight on Saturday night.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
